entry.title: Subcontracting delivery MESSAGE ME151 (0 item(s) posted)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I was facing 0 item(s) posted message while doing subcontracting delivery using ME2O, step followed is explained as below. Kindly request your valuable advice.!

Step 1: Master data set up, shipping point, delivery type related configuration completed

Step 2: Created subcontracting PO using ME21N
Step 3: Trying to create delivery using T code ME2O
Step 4: Shipping point is determining as per set up.
Step 5: Entered storage location, respective batch and quantity and click on continue
Step 6: Delivery not created, instead its showing message as 0 item(s) posted


We have enough stock for component material with respective storage location and batch.

T code used-ME2O
Environment- SAP ECC

Kindly request your valuable advice on same.

Awaiting your replay.!

Regards,

Prashanth

entry.title: Selecting or deleting more than 1 item in SAP Business One
entry.content: How can I delete or select more than 1 item in the Purchase order or in the GRPO

entry.title: ePPDS: Consider Opening Period during Planned Order creation - No opening dates in the past allowed
entry.content:
Hi all,

Within ePPDS I would like the standard lots heuristic to consider the opening period and to not create any planned order with an opening date in the past.

Let´s assume there is no planning time fence maintained, the demand is to today, Opening Period is 3 days, production duration is 4 days - I want the standard lots heuristic to create a planned order with Opening date today, Order start on day 3 and order end at day7.

The current behavior of the heuristic is that the opening date is 3 days in the past, start date is today and end date is on day 4. 

Please can you advise? 

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Configuration steps for process STO from SO with reference PR
entry.content:
Dear All,

Introduction:

We have 2 different locations, first one specific to deliver goods to customers but haven’t any stocks related to sales order line items, second location has stock and needs to transfer these goods to first location by system, then receipt stock in first location in this time stock it’s available to delivered to customer.

System process:

SO >> PR >> STO

Configurations steps:

  1. Assign PO type for Sales Organization:

SPRO --> Enterprise Structure --> Definition --> Sales and Distribution --> Define, copy, delete, check Sales organization --> Order Type.

  1. Configure item category:

Sales and Distribution --> Sales --> Sales Documents --> Sales Document Item --> Define Item Categories >>> Then enable check box Create PO automatic.

  1. Configure schedule line category:

Sales and Distribution --> Sales --> Sales Documents --> Schedule Lines --> Define Schedule Line Categories.

PO Type --> as u have

Item Category --> 0

Account Assignment Category --> D

Then enable check box for Purchase requisition with delivery scheduling.

  1. Determine Requirement Type by Item Category and MRP Type:

Item categories > MRP Type > Requirement type.

  1. Configure Scope of Availability Check:

  1. Generate new sales order type and link it with new setting.
  2. After receipt goods in second location and customer doesn’t need these goods:

Go through MIGO > Transfer posting > Other > MVT 411 E

Insert sales order no, from & destination’s plant (second plant) in this time after post, the stock moved from special stock in sales order to unrestricted.

Regards.

entry.title: MRP MD01N: Inconsistent Component PR Creation and Stock Consideration Behavior with/without Subcon.
entry.content:
Dear team,

 

Issue Summary:
When executing MRP Live (MD01N), the system shows inconsistent behavior for component purchase requisition (PR) creation and stock consideration depending on whether Subcontracting MRP Area configuration is active.

 

Prerequisite Configuration Setup:

  • MRP Area type (MDLV-BERTY) = 02 – Storage Location is configured.

 

Prerequisite Master Data Setup:

  • Component material Issuing Storage Location (STPO-LGORT) is maintained in the Bill of Materials (BOM).
  • Corresponding Storage Location type MRP Area is assigned in the component material master MRP1 view (MDMA)

 

Requirements summary:

Requirement#

Description

1

Component PR to be created at BU level MRP Area - When the component material Issuing storage location (STPO-LGORT) is set in the Bill of Materials (BOM), the component purchase requisition (PR) should be created at the BU level MRP area of Component material Issuing storage location (STPO-LGORT).

2

Component Stock of BU level MRP Area should be considered - When the component material Issuing storage location (STPO-LGORT) is set in the Bill of Materials (BOM), the component stock of storage location of respective BU level MRP area should be considered, and system should not consider neighbor BU level MRP area stock.

3

Component Stock at subcon Vendor Location should be considered during planning run – Unnecessary PR should not be created if sufficient component stock is available at Subcon Vendor location

 

 

Observed Behavior:

Scenario

Req#1 – PR created in Storage loc. MRP area

Req#2 – Stock from Storage loc. MRP area considered

Req#3 – Stock from Subcon vendor location considered

Without Subcontracting MRP Area configuration

Yes

Yes

No

With Subcontracting MRP Area configuration

No

No

Yes

 

Expected Behavior:
The MD01N should:

  • Create PRs in the storage location type MRP area of issuing storage location (STPO-LGORT)
  • Consider stock from the same MRP area.
  • Consider stock from the subcontracting vendor location.

Scenario

Req#1

Req#2

Req#3

With or without Subcon MRP Area configuration

Yes

Yes

Yes

 

Preference:

  1. Preferred Option: Meet all three requirements without activating subcontracting MRP area configuration.
  2. Alternative Option: Meet all three requirements with subcontracting MRP area configuration active.

 

Business Impact:

  • Unnecessary PRs are generated even though there is enough stock in subcontracting vendor’s storage location.
  • Available component stock at the vendor location, Storage location level MRP area is not effectively utilized.
  • leads to excess procurement, higher inventory, and inaccurate MRP planning results.

 

Questions to SCN.

  • Is there any SAP standard configuration or master data setting available to meet all three requirements simultaneously?
  • Could you please confirm whether there is any SAP Note available to achieve this behavior?

 

Thanks & Regards,

Manoahr

entry.title: Stock Values Showing Zero Post Stock Adjustment
entry.content:
Stock adjusted items off and on due to the original materials having an incorrect finish, therefore we had to change the products to a new material number and material finish.

The original PO was raised against the incorrect finish, the PO is closed and the invoice to the supplier has been paid, therefore we are unable to reverse. 

Since adjusting the correctly labelled materials into stock, the value is now showing (as these products are not linked to a PO, so effectively not purchased).

How do we process this stock to show the correct value?

entry.title: Can F0843 GR app be called from PO List app?
entry.content:
Based on my research, the only Fiori app for performing a GR for external material is F0843. I'm disappointed that it has no filter/selection options. What if user does not know the PO? Clearly app is intended for a mobile device worker who will perform the GR upon physical receipt. I'm interested if a Fiori app can replace MIGO for simple GRs on the desktop PC.

I was hoping an app like F2358 Monitor PO Items could hyperlink call F0843. But I don't see any 'related apps' or other hyperlink native ability to do that.

Am I just hitting a gap with SAP's Fiori design, where they haven't created a MIGO_GR fiori equivalent?

entry.title: Differentiate free-of-charge vs standard deliveries at outbound delivery header in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are working in an SAP Public Cloud environment and facing the following challenge in the Warehouse Monitor:
Outbound delivery documents use the same delivery type (LF) for both processes – standard sales and free-of-charge deliveries. At the outbound delivery header, we cannot find any field or criterion to differentiate these two types of deliveries.

The only difference we currently see is at the item level, where the item category differs:

  • TAN = standard sales
  • CBXN = free-of-charge delivery

However, there is no way to distinguish them at the header level, and in SAP Public Cloud there is a restriction that we cannot create a new delivery type.

Question:
Is there any way to differentiate free-of-charge deliveries from standard sales deliveries at the outbound delivery header in EWM? Can we add a custom field or use another approach (e.g., BAdI, extensibility options)? Has anyone faced this scenario and found a solution in the Public Cloud environment?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Intercompany stock transfer what happens when a lower of higher amount reaches the other warehouse?
entry.content:
(5hp) Situation: S4 public cloud -> EWM -> third party warehouse.
The third party warehouse sends a message that goes into S4 through Boomi.
This should fill in the put away quantity. 
We will then use a job to post goods receipt.

Problem what if less or more stock arrives at the third party warehouse? 
How can we close the NBIC order? What happens to the stock in transit?

entry.title: Create delivery with multiple STO
entry.content:
Hi experts,

 

We'd like to create a single delivery (VL10B or VL10D) with multiple STOs (same product, source and destination).

Is there any way to have it?

We tried to follow the steps mentioned at SAP NOTE 2172388 (2172388 - Stock transport orders (STO) are not combined into one delivery - SAP ERP & SAP S/4HANA | SAP Knowledge Base Article) but it didn't work.


Is there any idea if it is possible?

The intention is to have as below:

Delivery A - Item 1 - (STO 1 - Item 1)
Delivery A - Item 2 - (STO 2 - Item 1)
Delivery A - Item 3 - (STO 3 - Item 1)

We have already set the parameters at transaction VTLA as below:

Thanks a lot!

Best regards!

 

Victor Leao

entry.title: Shipping point issue in Return to Vendor
entry.content:
Hello All,

My Enterprise structure-

Plant - P001

Sales Org - S001

Distribution channels - D1 (Domestic), D2 (Import)

Division - 00

Plant is linked to both S001,D1 and S001,D2

Now we are trying to create a Return to Vendor order and we are getting the error No shipping point could be determined for Shipping condition , Loading Group 001, Plant P001.

Our supplier is extended to two sales areas S001, D1,00 and S001,D2,00 . But this supplier is an Import supplier hence S001,D2,00 is the one of concern here. Shipping condition in this Sales Area is marked as Z1. However in the error we could see that the Shipping condition determined is blank. 
Is this because in the SPRO configuration “Shipping data for plant”, the Sales area for our plant P001 is updated as S001,D1,00.

Is it due to this configuration that the system is trying to search the shipping condition for S001,D1,00 in the BP? Because for this sales area, the shipping condition is blank.

Need advise on how to handle this ?

entry.title: How system make to consider planned delivery time into SFG/FG Prod Order's Start date and end date
entry.content: In SAP public cloud, there is requirement to consider the planned delivery time of raw material while creating planned order post MRP run. The current system is not taking the raw material delivery into consideration.

entry.title: SAP Practice and Get a Certificate
entry.content:
I have recently completed the course “Exploring Charges and Settlement in SAP S/4HANA Transportation Management” and successfully passed all quizzes at the end of each module. The course status on my SAP Learning account is marked as “Completed.”

However, I would like to kindly clarify the following points:

  1. I am unable to access a practice environment to apply what I have learned. Could you please advise whether this course includes any hands-on system access, or if there is a recommended practice system (such as a trial or learning tenant) for SAP S/4HANA Transportation Management?

  2. I have not received or found any downloadable certificate or record of completion. Could you please confirm whether this course provides a certificate (or statement of completion), and if so, where it can be accessed within the SAP Learning platform?

If this course does not include a certificate by default, I would also appreciate guidance on the appropriate SAP certification path related to SAP S/4HANA Transportation Management.

Thank you very much in advance for your support and guidance.

Kind regards,
Gandab Valiyeva

entry.title: In MTO, Sequent ion of Material Production is not well defined, it depends on Raw Material Quality.
entry.content:
In MTO, For a single FG production, There are four stages at SFG levels production to be executed then FG Production is carried out.

At FG, 

1. Packing

At SFG Levels,

1. Drawing operation (Material code 1)

2. Drawing Operation (Material Code 2)

3. Annealing Operation (Material Code 3 )

4. Grinding Operation (Material Code 4)

Based on Raw Material Quality,  it is decided which combination is to be performed whether to perform (grinding & Packing

)/(Annealing, Grinding & Packing). Please suggest how to let system make to understand that particular sets of production/planned orders are to be performed. As after MRP Run Planned Orders will be created at each levels of BOM Components then how planned order will be treated in this case and which are not required to perform actually real time scenarios and consumption of Raw material directly getting consumed in Grinding and then in Packing consumption.

Remaining Planned orders & Production order, how it will be treated in real time for the order which is not required to perform and the material consumption which can be directly consumed at any stages based on requirement.

entry.title: Issue with shipping point during Return To Vendor
entry.content:
We have one Plant - VP01

This plant is assigned to two sales areas VS01/10/00 and VS02/20/00 where 10 is for Direct Sales and 20 is for Export Sales.

Now when we are creating a return to the Export Vendor (BP extended to Sales area VS01/20/00 alone), we are getting the shipping point determination error because the system is searching for the shipping conditions in Sales area VS01/10/00 because in the “Shipping data for plant” configuration, my plant has sales area VS01/10/00 maintained.

Now as this is an export vendor, we don’t extend it to sales areas VS01/10/00. Hence we are unable to perform the returns at all. 

So can anyone suggest how we can handle this case? Because we can’t keep changing the SPRO configuration Shipping data for plants again and again.

Should we implement any custom logic or can this be solved by standard SAP?

entry.title: Variant Configuration – Subassembly BOM items with selection conditions not exploding in CU51
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am struggling with a variant configuration issue in a multi‑level BOM and would really appreciate some guidance.

I have created a configurable material with a characteristic ZS5_LT that represents the length of a ladder.
In the BOM of this configurable material, I have several ladder components, each with a selection condition, for example:

  • 4.4 m ladder: selection condition ZS5_LT = 4.4
  • other ladders with similar conditions, depending on the value of ZS5_LT.

When I test this material in transaction CU50, everything works as expected:
If I set ZS5_LT = 4.4, the 4.4 m ladder is selected correctly in the result.

However, my problem occurs when I use this configurable material as a subassembly in another assembly.

Scenario:

  • The configurable material is inserted as a component in a higher‑level assembly in the BOM.
  • In CSKB / CU51, I select the configurable subassembly, enter the configuration there, and set ZS5_LT = 4.4 m.
  • Then I press “Result” or go back to the BOM view and expect to see the 4.4 m ladder under the configurable subassembly.

What actually happens:

  • No ladder is selected at all under the configurable subassembly when the selection condition is active.
  • If I remove the selection condition from the 4.4 m ladder item in the BOM, the ladder appears in CU51 as a static component.
  • So the BOM explosion for the subassembly works, but the selection condition based on ZS5_LT is not evaluated as I expect in the order BOM context.

My understanding is that this might be related to multi‑level configuration and how characteristics are evaluated at different levels (parent vs. subassembly). It looks like the system is looking for the characteristic higher up in the structure, but the characteristic is only defined and used for the configurable material.

Any hints, best practices, or example setups for this kind of multi‑level configuration with a configurable subassembly in CU51 would be very helpful.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Catch Weight Management in Receiving Process
entry.content:
Hi 

I have set up Catch Weight Management in my On Prem S/HANA box 2022 release 107.

I have all configuration and master data in place which is allowing me to manage parallel units of measure in handling units and storage bins.

I have only been able to capture the valuation quantity during packing of my inbound delivery in PRDI. Once the valuation quantity is measured against each HU am I able to goods receipt and create putaway tasks for my handling units.

My WPT has the field "Valuation Quantity Input Required for WT Confirmation" (/SCWM/T333-CWMEAS) checked.

I have read note 3297858 which advises of a restriction in RFUI processing for catch weight products, the resolution proposes to use RF Putaway. I have tried confirming my putaway WT in PTHUSI but there is nothing appearing for capturing the valuation quantity.

I have seen a YouTube video of an RFUI screen being able to capture this information but I'm not sure if it has been developed or if it is a standard screen.

Does anyone know if there is a way of being able to record valuation quantities in RFUI for Catch Weight products in Embedded EWM without a new Catch Weight screen being development?

Thanks in advance 

Mike

entry.title: In MTO, SO field in Planned/Purchase Req. is taking quotation/Inquiry no. of Reference Sales Order
entry.content:
Hello Team,

In MTO scenarios, the generated Planned order/ Purchase Requisition number having the account assignment section where Sales Order field is available is taking the reference of Inquiry or Quotation number for the respective Sales Order. It also results in impacting the report of sales Order based output details.

As per business requirment, the client is expecting the output based on the Sales Order not on the basis of Inquiry/Quotation number for Assigned Sales Order. Please suggest how to map the scenario to get the desired result output, without impacting the other modules fundamental concepts like as Costing, Delivery and all. Also, suggest the advantages and disadvantages of the other functionalities.
